zone.line: The Magus Zoroaster, my dead child
Met his own image walking in the garden,
That apparition, sole of men, he saw.
For know there are two worlds of life & death
Which thou henceforth art doomed to interweave
One that which thou beholdest, but the other
Is underneath the grave, where do inhabit
The shadows of all forms that think & live
Till death unite them, and they part no more,
Dreams & the light imaginings of men
And all that faith creates, or love desires,
Terrible, strange, sublime & beauteous shapes.
There thou art, & dost hang, a writhing shade
shaken
'Mid whirlwind-peopled mountains; all the Gods
Are there, & all the Powers of nameless worlds
Vast, sceptered Phantoms; heroes, men, & beasts
And Demogorgon, a tremendous Gloom
throned
And he, the Supreme Tyrant on his throne
On
Of burning Gold. Son one of these shall utter
The curse which all remember. Call at will
Thine own ghost, or the ghost of Jupiter,
